poem:
### Remembering Marianne

In Reading's quiet streets we walked,  
schoolyards echoing with dreams,  
knowing stars burn far brighter  
than the dim-lit class routines.  
We watched as she took flight,  
St. Joseph's girl turned legend,  
a comet in our small heaven,  
while we stood in wings of youth,  
spellbound by her destined light.

She was one of the reasons so many of us wanted to join the town’s Progress theatre, or act in our school". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long.
